info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 3:37AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS WILL MAKE TRAVEL IMPOSSIBLE FOR PORTIONS OF THE NIAGARA FRONTIER EARLY THIS MORNING... HAZARDS...The combination of a band of heavy snow and winds gusting to 55 mph is producing BLIZZARD conditions. Visibility within the band is ZERO. There are numerous vehicles stranded on the roadways. DO NOT attempt to travel in this band. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 336 am EST, a 10 to 15 mile wide band extends from Buffalo to Grand Island northeast across the Northtowns and into northwest Genesee and portions of Orleans counties. This band is expected to drift a few miles north by 530 AM. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Medina, Albion, Williamsville, Grand Island, Pendleton, Pembroke, Akron and Erie Basin Marina. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 53. SAFETY INFO... Travel is nearly impossible in this area with blizzard conditions. &&
